title: An Open space secondary school at work
creator_contributor_role: South Australian Film Corporation, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Education - Study and teaching - Australia
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Education - Experimental methods
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Open plan schools - Australia
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/School management and organisation
description: Shows how individual differences in students' capacity to learn can in fact be used to benefit their intellectual growth. It gives an inside view of an Open Space School in operation, showing the advantages and day-to-day methods used in the Open Space School layout. Some of the problems which must be faced and solved by staff as well as students to promote an efficient and effective school are discussed.
